medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began at 2 p.m. on the day before admission with nausea, epigastric pain, and vomiting. The next morning, increasing asthma and right-sided back pain rated at 10/10. On presentation, the patient reported malaise, shaking chills, burning pins-and-needles sensation in limbs, and diffuse body pain also rated at 10/10.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of asthma, mild chronic obstructive pulmonary disease, anxiety, depression, chronic back pain, and alcohol abuse (with recent consumption of up to 18 beers daily). Allergic to codeine and had hallucinations with tramadol. Smoked one pack of cigarettes daily for 30 years. Past head trauma from a rusty nail a few days prior. Recent dental extractions 1-2 weeks before presentation.
medical_history.family_history: Both parents died at 72 years of age from myocardial infarctions.
medical_history.social_history: Lived with his wife and dog, which was fully vaccinated. Worked sporadically, recently installed air-conditioning systems.
